alert.note: Alert for Adair; Cherokee; Delaware; Haskell; Le Flore; Ottawa; Sequoyah (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued February 27 at 12:26AM CST until February 27 at 1:15AM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Benton County in northwestern Arkansas... West central Franklin County in west central Arkansas... Crawford County in northwestern Arkansas... Northern Sebastian County in west central Arkansas... Washington County in northwestern Arkansas... Eastern Delaware County in northeastern Oklahoma... Southern Ottawa County in northeastern Oklahoma... Northeastern Haskell County in southeastern Oklahoma... Sequoyah County in east central Oklahoma... Adair County in northeastern Oklahoma... Northeastern Le Flore County in southeastern Oklahoma... Southeastern Cherokee County in east central Oklahoma... * Until 115 AM CST. * At 1224 AM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 2 miles northwest of South West City to 3 miles northwest of Siloam Springs to 3 miles northeast of Christie to 4 miles west of Gans, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Observed. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. This storm has a history of producing 70mph winds. * Locations in or near the path include... Fort Smith... Fayetteville... Springdale... Rogers... Bentonville... Van Buren... Siloam Springs... Miami... Sallisaw... Stilwell... Jay... Cedarville... Mountainburg... Natural Dam... Bella Vista... Lowell... Grove... Farmington... Alma... Pea Ridge... This includes the following highways, Interstate 40 in Arkansas between mile markers 0 and 23. Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 302 and 328. Interstate 44 between mile markers 297 and 308. Interstate 540 between mile markers 1 and 14. Interstate 49 between mile markers 22 and 93. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CST for southeastern, northeastern and east central Oklahoma. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Adair; Cherokee; Delaware; Haskell; Le Flore; Ottawa; Sequoyah
